p: In both cooperation networks, we identified the transcription factors MYB1, MYB4, MYB24, MYB46, MYB55, MYB65, MYB77, MYB113, and FaEOBII, which belong to the MYB superfamily. A large number of MYB TFs play central roles in a variety of physiological processes, especially growth, development, synthesis of secondary metabolites, metabolism, and responses to biotic and abiotic stresses [ 76, 77, 78, 79, 80].
